00050 static ssize_t show_heartbeat(
00051         struct device *dev,
00052         struct device_attribute *attr,
00053         char *buf)
00054 {
00055         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(dev);
00056 
00057         if (device != 0){
00058                 return sprintf(buf, "%d\n", acq200_getHeartbeat(device));
00059         }else{
00060                 return -ENODEV;
00061         }
00062 }
00063 
00064 static DEVICE_ATTR(heartbeat, S_IRUGO, show_heartbeat, 0);
00065 
00066 
00067 /* from getBoards.pm ..
00068         if ( $refbrec->{fun} >= 72 && $refbrec->{fun} <= 120 ){
00069 # works for CPV5350 in Schroff backplane
00070             $refbrec->{lognum} = 9-($refbrec->{fun}/8-8);
00071 #           print "getSlotBoardNum() returns $refbrec->{lognum}\n";
00072         }else{
00073             die "Slot addressing scheme failed";
00074         }
00075     }
00076 */
00077 
00078 int acq200_get_cpci_slot(struct pci_dev * pci_dev)
00079 {
00080         u32 devfn =  pci_dev->devfn;
00081         int slot = -1;
00082 
00083         if (devfn >= 72 && devfn <= 120){
00084                 slot = 9 - (devfn/8 -8);                        
00085         }
00086         return slot;    
00087 }
00088 static ssize_t show_cpci_slot(
00089         struct device *dev,
00090         struct device_attribute *attr,
00091         char *buf)
00092 {
00093         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(dev);
00094 
00095         if (device != 0){               
00096                 return sprintf(buf, "%d\n", 
00097                         acq200_get_cpci_slot(device->pci_dev));
00098         }else{
00099                 return -ENODEV;
00100         }
00101 }
00102 
00103 static DEVICE_ATTR(cpci_slot, S_IRUGO, show_cpci_slot, 0);

00194 
00195 static ssize_t dumpDmaBuf(
00196         struct DmaBuf *dma_buf, char *buf, int maxbuf, const char* id)
00197 {
00198         return snprintf(buf, maxbuf, "%10s:%d %p 0x%08x len %d\n",
00199                         id,
00200                         dma_buf->order, dma_buf->va, dma_buf->pa,
00201                         dma_buf_len(dma_buf));
00202 }
00203 
00204 static ssize_t show_buffers(
00205         struct device *dev,
00206         struct device_attribute *attr,
00207         char *buf)
00208 {
00209         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDevice(dev);
00210         int cc = dumpDmaBuf(&device->dma_buf, buf, 80, "dma_buf");      
00211         if (device->AB[0].va){
00212                 cc += dumpDmaBuf(&device->AB[0], buf+cc, 80, "buffer A");
00213         }
00214         if (device->AB[1].va){
00215                 cc += dumpDmaBuf(&device->AB[1], buf+cc, 80, "buffer B");
00216         }
00217         return cc;
00218 }
00219 
00220 
00221 static DEVICE_ATTR(buffers, S_IRUGO, show_buffers, 0);

00223 void acq200_device_create_file(
00224         struct device * dev, struct device_attribute * attr,
00225         const char *file, int line)
00226 {
00227         if (device_create_file(dev, attr)){
00228                 err("%s:%d device_create_file", file, line);
00229         }
00230 }

00233 void acq200_create_sysfs_device(struct device *dev)
00234 {
00235         dbg(1, "01");
00236         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_host_pa);
00237         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_host_len);
00238         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_heartbeat);
00239         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_cpci_slot);
00240         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_interrupt_count);
00241 
00242         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_available_input_channels);
00243         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_available_output_channels);
00244         DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &dev_attr_buffers);
00245         dbg(1, "99");
00246 }
00247 
00248 void acq200_remove_sysfs_device(struct device *dev)
00249 {
00250         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_host_pa);
00251         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_host_len);
00252         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_heartbeat);
00253         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_cpci_slot);
00254         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_interrupt_count);
00255 
00256         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_available_input_channels);
00257         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_available_output_channels);
00258         device_remove_file(dev, &dev_attr_buffers);
00259 }

00263 static ssize_t show_imask(
00264         struct CLASS_DEVICE *dev, 
00265 #ifndef ORIGINAL_CLASS_DEVICE_INTERFACE
00266         struct device_attribute *attr, 
00267 #endif
00268         char* buf)
00269 {
00270         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDeviceFromClass(dev);
00271 
00272         if (device != 0){
00273                 return sprintf(buf, "0x%08x\n", device->imask);
00274         }else{
00275                 return -ENODEV;
00276         }
00277 }
00278 
00279 static ssize_t store_imask(
00280         struct CLASS_DEVICE *dev, 
00281 #ifndef ORIGINAL_CLASS_DEVICE_INTERFACE
00282         struct device_attribute *attr, 
00283 #endif
00284         const char *buf, size_t count)
00285 {
00286         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDeviceFromClass(dev);
00287         u32 imask;
00288 
00289         if (device != 0){
00290                 if (    sscanf(buf, "0x%x", &imask) == 1 ||
00291                         sscanf(buf, "%x", &imask ) == 1     ){
00292                         device->imask = imask;
00293                         acq200_intsDisable(imask);
00294                         acq200_intsEnable(~imask);
00295                         return count;   
00296                 }else{
00297                         return -EBADR;
00298                 }
00299         }else{
00300                 return -ENODEV;
00301         }
00302 }
00303 
00304 static CLASS_DEVICE_ATTR(imask, S_IRUGO|S_IWUSR, show_imask, store_imask);
00305 
00306 
00307 static ssize_t show_dev(
00308         struct CLASS_DEVICE *dev, 
00309 #ifndef ORIGINAL_CLASS_DEVICE_INTERFACE
00310         struct device_attribute *attr, 
00311 #endif
00312         char *buf)
00313 /* major:minor output for udev. minor is a dummy (we use all of them!) */
00314 {
00315         struct Acq200Device *device = acq200_lookupDeviceFromClass(dev);
00316 
00317         if (device){
00318                 return sprintf(buf, "%d:%d\n", device->ldev.major, 0);
00319         }else{
00320                 return -ENODEV;
00321         }
00322 }

00325 static CLASS_DEVICE_ATTR(dev, S_IRUGO, show_dev, 0);

00333                 err("%s:%d device_create_file", file, line);
00334         }
00335 }
00336 
00337 #define CLASS_DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, attr) \
00338         acq200_class_device_create_file(dev, attr, __FILE__, __LINE__)
00339 
00340 void acq200_create_sysfs_class(struct class_device *dev)
00341 {
00342         dbg(1, "01");
00343         CLASS_DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &class_device_attr_imask);
00344         CLASS_DEVICE_CREATE_FILE(dev, &class_device_attr_dev);
00345         dbg(1, "9");
00346 }
00347 
00348 void acq200_remove_sysfs_class(struct class_device *dev)
00349 {
00350         class_device_remove_file(dev, &class_device_attr_imask);
00351         class_device_remove_file(dev, &class_device_attr_dev);
00352 }
